page.title: 01Summary of our Area
page.content: The market town of Cowbridge is believed to be built on the site of a Roman Camp. Notable buildings include the 13th century Holy Cross Church, Georgian houses and the Bear Hotel; the latter being an old coaching inn. There are a variety of shops both in the main street and adjacent alleys, as well as a Health Centre, a Library, Town Hall, Banks, Building Societies and eight Public Houses. The Old Boys Grammar School with its historic links with Jesus College, Oxford, is still in use, although today the locality is served by a mixed comprehensive school and both English and Welsh speaking primary schools. A marked increase in housing and population has occured during the last 20 years throughout the area. Around Cowbridge with Llanblethian the area is mostly farmland with 4 hamlets and villages.
